revised_title: Anatomical Study of Female Organs and Placentation in the Raccoon
tldr: The author conducted an anatomical study of the female organs and placentation in the raccoon. They described the ovaries, Fallopian tubes, uterus, vagina, and urogenital canal in detail, as well as the placenta and its attachment to the uterus. This research contributed to the understanding of reproductive anatomy in mammals, particularly in the order Carnivora.
